unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Maharashtra**
normalised: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26, 2023 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program across the state. The initiative, aimed at enhancing grid efficiency and consumer empowerment, has already seen installation of over 5 lakh smart meters in key urban areas including Pune and Nagpur.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O. Limited (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program across the state. The initiative, aimed at enhancing grid efficiency and consumer empowerment, has already seen installation of over five lakh smart meters in key urban areas including Pune and Nagpur.

unnormalised: The project, budgeted at Rs. 10,000 crore, aims to replace all conventional meters with smart meters by December 31, 2025. Officials stated that smart meters will enable real-time monitoring of energy consumption, facilitating better demand response and reducing power theft, a perennial challenge in several regions. Consumers will gain access to detailed consumption data via a dedicated mobile app, allowing for informed energy management and potential cost savings.
normalised: The project, budgeted at rupee ten thousand crore, aims to replace all conventional meters with smart meters by December thirty first, two thousand and twenty five. Officials stated that smart meters will enable real-time monitoring of energy consumption, facilitating better demand response and reducing power theft, a perennial challenge in several regions. Consumers will gain access to detailed consumption data via a dedicated mobile app, allowing for informed energy management and potential cost savings.

unnormalised: Early data from pilot projects indicates a reduction in aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses by 15% in areas equipped with the new meters. A special training program was conducted for meter readers on 15/08/2023 at 10:00 hrs to familiarize them with the new technology. Further tenders for the procurement of an additional 20 lakh meters are expected to be floated by 09:00 hrs on November 10, 2023.
normalised: Early data from pilot projects indicates a reduction in aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses by fifteen percent in areas equipped with the new meters. A special training program was conducted for meter readers on fifteenth August two thousand and twenty three at ten o'clock hours to familiarize them with the new technology. Further tenders for the procurement of an additional twenty lakh meters are expected to be floated by nine o'clock hours on November tenth, two thousand and twenty three.
